parameters.prompt:
You are a command generation assistant.
Generate ONE safe shell command to perform the task.
Rules:
1. Prefer harmless read/print operations (echo, printf, ls, cat a provided file).
2. Do NOT use destructive actions (rm, mv overwriting, sudo, chmod 777, curl | sh, pip install, git clone).
3. If task implies file creation, use echo 'content' > filename (no redirection of untrusted var expansions).
4. Avoid command injection characters unless essential (&, ;, |, >, >>, &&). Use only what is required.
5. Output MUST be returned via generate_command tool call.

<Task Description>
Print the phrase CLI Test Success
</Task Description>

<Related Context JSON>
{
  "note": "testing generated command"
}
</Related Context JSON>

function.name: generate_command
function.description: Generate a safe, single-line shell command to accomplish the described task.

command.description: A single safe shell command. Prefer POSIX utilities (echo, ls, cat). No chaining with &&, |, ; unless necessary.

output.error: Failed to connect to LLM API
